title: Poland, Hungary, and India Join Next Axiom Crew
summary: Axiom Space’s fourth mission aboard SpaceX’s Crew Dragon spacecraft is set to carry astronauts from Poland, Hungary, and India next year, setting the stage for yet another record breaking international segment.

title: U.S. Air Force awards $14.9 million contract to Capella Space for radar imaging
summary: The multi-year contract is to integrate Capella's radar imaging data into a U.S. Air Force Research Lab experimental cloud-based platform

title: KVH Industries leans on maritime connectivity competitor Starlink for growth
summary: Maritime connectivity provider KVH Industries is seeing signs of a turnaround after buying a chunk of satellite capacity from Starlink, SpaceX’s broadband constellation in non-geostationary orbit.

title: Artemis II Core Stage Arrives at Kennedy
summary: Teams transport NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) core stage into the Vehicle Assembly Building at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on July 24, 2024. Tugboats and towing vessels moved the Pegasus barge and 212-foot-long core stage 900-miles to the Florida spaceport from NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans, where it was manufactured and assembled. […]

title: There Are No Imaginary Boundaries for Dr. Ariadna Farrés-Basiana
summary: Dr. Ariadna Farrés-Basiana would look up at the sky and marvel at the immensity of space when she was younger. Now, the bounds are limitless as she helps NASA explore the expansive universe by computing the trajectories and maneuvers to get a spacecraft into space. Name: Dr. Ariadna Farrés-BasianaTitle: Astrodynamics and solar radiation pressure specialist, […]

title: Celebrating NASA’s Coast Guard Astronauts on Coast Guard Day
summary: Each Aug. 4, Coast Guard Day commemorates the founding on Aug. 4, 1790, of the U.S. Coast Guard as the Revenue-Marine by Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton. Although considered an internal event for active duty and reserve Coast Guard members, we take the opportunity of Coast Guard Day to honor the astronauts who began […]

title: NASA Ames to Host Supercomputing Resources for UC Berkeley Researchers
summary: Under a new agreement, NASA will host supercomputing resources for the University of California, Berkeley, at the agency’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley. The agreement is part of an expanding partnership between Ames and UC Berkeley and will support the development of novel computing algorithms and software for a wide variety of scientific […]

title: Rocket Lab to launch 5th mission for Japanese Earth observation company, Synspective
summary: The Electron rocket will carry a StriX satellite to low Earth orbit as part of Synspective’s synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite constellation. Liftoff is set for Saturday, Aug. 3, at 4:39 a.m. NZT (Friday, Aug. 2, at 12:39 p.m. EDT, 1639 UTC).

title: MESSENGER – From Setbacks to Success
summary: The excerpts below are taken from Discovery Program oral history interviews conducted in 2009 by Dr. Susan Niebur and tell the story of the hurdles the MESSENGER (MErcury Surface, Space ENvironment, GEochemistry, and Ranging) mission team faced with the technical requirements of visiting Mercury, budget challenges, and schedule impacts —all while keeping their mission goals […]

title: NASA weighs Boeing vs. SpaceX choice in bringing back Starliner astronauts
summary: NASA management has been in deep discussion this week about whether to return the agency’s astronauts on board Boeing’s misfiring Starliner capsule or to go with the alternative of using a SpaceX craft to rescue the crew.
